trans-unit.source: SQL Database Business Continuity during Application Upgrade
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Business Continuity during Application Upgrade

trans-unit.source: This section provides guidance for business continuity to prevent downtime during an application upgrade.
trans-unit.target: This section provides guidance for business continuity to prevent downtime during an application upgrade.

trans-unit.source: In the context of Microsoft Azure the term 'application' refers to components such as front ends, services deployed in a cloud service, and the data tier used to persist application data or meta-data.
trans-unit.target: In the context of Microsoft Azure the term 'application' refers to components such as front ends, services deployed in a cloud service, and the data tier used to persist application data or meta-data.

trans-unit.source: Cloud applications are often designed to provide uninterrupted service 24x7.
trans-unit.target: Cloud applications are often designed to provide uninterrupted service 24x7.

trans-unit.source: Rolling out a new version of the application, when changes in the data tier are applied in the live site could potentially cause some disruption, such as reduced features being available or even complete downtime.
trans-unit.target: Rolling out a new version of the application, when changes in the data tier are applied in the live site could potentially cause some disruption, such as reduced features being available or even complete downtime.

trans-unit.source: When designing the application upgrade process the main goal should be eliminating or dramatically reducing the duration of time when application capability is reduced.
trans-unit.target: When designing the application upgrade process the main goal should be eliminating or dramatically reducing the duration of time when application capability is reduced.

trans-unit.source: To achieve that the process typically involves creation of a temporary copy of the application to be used as a backup in case the upgrade fails.
trans-unit.target: To achieve that the process typically involves creation of a temporary copy of the application to be used as a backup in case the upgrade fails.

trans-unit.source: The following factors should be considered when designing and planning the upgrade:
trans-unit.target: The following factors should be considered when designing and planning the upgrade:

trans-unit.source: Maximum acceptable time when the application will have reduced capability
trans-unit.target: Maximum acceptable time when the application will have reduced capability

trans-unit.source: Minimum set of features that will be available during the upgrade process
trans-unit.target: Minimum set of features that will be available during the upgrade process

trans-unit.source: Ability to roll back in case of any errors during upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Ability to roll back in case of any errors during upgrade.

trans-unit.source: This includes the cost of additional application components needed to create a temporary copy (such as additional premium databases for active geo-replication) and incremental costs for temporary deployments used by the upgrade process.
trans-unit.target: This includes the cost of additional application components needed to create a temporary copy (such as additional premium databases for active geo-replication) and incremental costs for temporary deployments used by the upgrade process.

trans-unit.source: If the application can temporarily operate in read-only mode the upgrade workflow could be designed to effectively eliminate the downtime altogether.
trans-unit.target: If the application can temporarily operate in read-only mode the upgrade workflow could be designed to effectively eliminate the downtime altogether.
